title: Phish - 1998-04-03 Nassau Coliseum (Archival Release) [FLAC] - r
description:
4/3/98 - Phish

Live Phish 04.03.98 is the second night of the four-night "Island Tour," recorded live at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, New York, on April 3, 1998.

The short mini-run quickly became one of the most popular Phish performances of all time, with the band mixing the funk of 1997 with the high-energy jams of the mid-1990s along with brand new compositions.

The second and final night of shows in New York is highlighted by a large-scale jam following Ween's "Roses are Free", rated by Phish fans as one of the group's greatest jams of all time. Other highlights include a fan running onstage during "Loving Cup" and being tackled by stage manager Pete Carini, all of which is reported during "Run Like an Antelope" by guitarist Trey Anastasio, who then rightfully begins the encore with a version of "Carini".

Bonus tracks include various soundcheck excerpts from the "Island Tour"


Disc one
"Mike's Song" (Gordon) - 14:19
"The Old Home Place" (Jayne, Webb) - 3:41
"Weekapaug Groove" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, McConnell) - 16:27
"Train Song" (Gordon, Linitz) - 2:59
"Billy Breathes" (Anastasio) - 7:38
"Beauty of My Dreams" (McCoury) - 2:41
"Dogs Stole Things" (Anastasio, Marshall) - 5:00
"Reba" (Anastasio) - 16:41
"My Soul" (Chenier) - 8:27

Disc two
"Roses Are Free" (Freeman, Melchiondo) - 5:33
"Nassau Jam" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, McConnell) - 21:56
"Piper" (Anastasio, Marshall) - 16:13
"Loving Cup" (Jagger, Richards) - 6:53
"Run Like an Antelope" (Anastasio, Marshall, Pollak) - 14:43

Disc three
Tracks 4-6 were recorded on April 2, 1998 at Nassau Coliseum, Uniondale, NY. Tracks 7-9 were recorded April 4, 1998 at the Civic Center, Providence, RI.
"Carini" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, McConnell) - 4:36
"Halley's Comet" (Wright) - 6:15
"Tweezer Reprise" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, McConnell) - 3:24
"Funky Bitch" (Seals) - 3:38
"Nassau Soundcheck Jam" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, McConnell) - 5:55
"Birds of a Feather" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, Marshall, McConnell) - 10:08
"Providence Soundcheck Jam" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, McConnell) - 9:10
"Shafty" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, Marshall, McConnell) - 15:23
"Roggae" (Anastasio, Fishman, Gordon, Marshall, McConnell) - 5:23

Notes: Weekapaug included a Crosseyed and Painless tease and a brief jam of the song that would eventually debut as Mozambique, as well as a tease of the theme from Brazil and a quick tease of Nellie Kane from Trey. A fan ran up on the stage during Loving Cup, prompting banter and subsequent singing of "Carini's gonna getcha" several times in the Antelope intro, as well as a Carini mention later in the song.
